reasoning: This describes the main objective of the system, which is to score sets of concepts based on an ontology.
This refers to the specific type of data or entities being scored, which are concepts in this case.
This is another key term in the text, representing a specific type of data or entity being scored.
This is a measure used to evaluate the performance of the system, representing the degree of coherence between the SRHs.
This describes the approach used to collect data for evaluating the system, which is an annotation experiment.
This refers to the specific type of data used in the annotation experiment, which are human annotators.
This is a measure used to compare the performance of the system, representing a benchmark or starting point.
This describes the specific dataset or resource used for evaluation, which is a German corpus of SRHs.
This is the number of SRHs used in the evaluation, which is a key metric or quantity in the research.
This is the result of evaluating the system against the annotated data, representing the percentage of correctly classified SRHs.
This is the baseline or starting point for evaluating the system, representing the percentage of correctly classified SRHs in the absence of the system.
